dt: {bc}the existence of a thing as contrasted with its attributes
{bc}something that has separate and distinct existence and objective or conceptual reality
{bc}an organization (such as a business or governmental unit) that has an identity separate from those of its members

et: Medieval Latin {it}entitas{/it}, from Latin {it}ent-, ens{/it} existing thing, from coined present participle of {it}esse{/it} to be {ma}{mat|is|}{/ma}
shortdef: being, existence; especially : independent, separate, or self-contained existence
the existence of a thing as contrasted with its attributes
something that has separate and distinct existence and objective or conceptual reality

dt.t: Since most entrepreneurs use a {wi}flow-through entity{/wi}, such as a partnership or S corporation for their business, every dollar of deduction actually reduces your personal income tax.

dt: {bc}a business entity (such as a sole proprietorship, partnership, or {d_link|S corporation|S corporation}) whose income is taxed as the owner's personal income at the individual rate rather than as business income for federal income taxes

dt.t: a law that provides tax breaks to {wi}pass-through entities{/wi}

shortdef: a business entity (such as a sole proprietorship, partnership, or S corporation) whose income is taxed as the owner's personal income at the individual rate rather than as business income for federal income taxes —called also flow-through entity, pass-through
